ai_yoast_description:
Empowering Independence: A Look at Ability360

For over four decades, Ability360 has been at the forefront of empowering individuals with disabilities. The organization's mission focuses on promoting programs that encourage personal responsibility, consequently leading to independent lifestyles. Therefore, its vision encompasses a community where all individuals, regardless of ability, can fully participate. Indeed, Ability360 provides a wide array of services designed to support and uplift the lives of people with disabilities.

In addition, through its comprehensive services, Ability360 offers vital resources to improve the quality of life of the visually impaired. These services include independent living skills training, access to employment opportunities, and assistance with home modifications. Moreover, Ability360 is committed to advocacy, offering monthly workshops and the Arizona Education & Empowerment Initiative classes to assist. Consequently, it helps individuals learn self-advocacy skills, navigate the system, and understand their rights.

Furthermore, in addition to these core services, Ability360 offers opportunities for peer mentoring and support, thus helping its audience to achieve their goals. Because it aims to increase consumer control, the organization provides assistance with Social Security Disability Benefits. Additionally, it aims to educate users via Small Business Educational Webinar Series to teach them the foundations of entrepreneurship. Therefore, Ability360 also provides community services to help improve the lives of all its users.

For instance, Ability360 is more than just a service provider; however, it is a community hub. It strives to create an inclusive environment that fosters self-sufficiency and equal opportunities for all. As a result, the organization’s comprehensive approach ensures that individuals with disabilities can live fulfilling and independent lives. Ultimately, Ability360 embodies a commitment to empowering the visually impaired community and fostering a society where everyone can thrive.

Learn more at Ability360 and explore other vision-focused resources at the Eye Spy directory.

listing_title: Academy for Certification of Vision Rehabilitation & Education Professionals
ai_yoast_description:
ACVREP: Advancing Professional Competency for Vision Rehabilitation Professionals

The primary mission of Academy for Certification of Vision Rehabilitation & Education Professionals (ACVREP) is to ensure that individuals with visual impairments worldwide receive services from highly qualified professionals. To achieve this, ACVREP focuses on establishing and maintaining rigorous certification programs. These programs are therefore designed to assess and validate the knowledge and skills of vision rehabilitation specialists. Consequently, they promote quality service delivery and ethical practice within the field.

ACVREP's commitment to quality is further demonstrated through its adherence to best practices. Therefore, it builds trust and confidence among employers, individuals seeking services, and the certified professionals themselves. Moreover, ACVREP offers certifications for various specializations. These include Certified Orientation & Mobility Specialists (COMS), Certified Low Vision Therapists (CLVT), Certified Vision Rehabilitation Therapists (CVRT), Certified Assistive Technology Instructional Specialists (CATIS), and Certified Deafblind Intervenor Specialists (CDBIS). Additionally, these certifications are a testament to ACVREP's dedication to a comprehensive approach to vision rehabilitation, addressing diverse needs within the visually impaired community.

Furthermore, ACVREP's vision extends beyond just certification. Indeed, it fosters a community of professionals dedicated to enhancing the lives of those with visual impairments. ACVREP also provides resources for continuing education, ensuring that certified professionals remain up-to-date with the latest advancements and best practices. As a result, ACVREP strives to empower individuals with visual impairments.

In addition to certification, ACVREP also offers a Chromebook Accessibility Training Certificate Program, which therefore gives consumers and professionals more opportunities. So, the organization is dedicated to advancing professional competency. Because of this, ACVREP contributes to a more inclusive world. Learn more at Academy for Certification of Vision Rehabilitation & Education Professionals (ACVREP) and explore other vision-focused resources at the Eye Spy directory.
ai_wp_excerpt: ACVREP advances professional competency for those who are blind or have low vision. ACVREP offers certifications for vision impairment specialists, including COMS, CVRT, and CLVT, ensuring high-quality service and ethical practice worldwide.
listing_tags: Academy for Certification of Vision Rehabilitation & Education Professionals,Tucson,Arizona,AZ

ai_yoast_description:
Access Professional Interpreting: Your Partner in Communication

At Access Professional Interpreting, the mission is to empower effective communication for individuals who are deaf or hard of hearing, and also for those who require sign language interpretation. The company provides professional American Sign Language (ASL) interpreting services across Arizona. Therefore, the services offered support a wide array of settings, including legal, educational, medical, and community environments. Consequently, the focus is on ensuring clear and accurate communication for all participants.

With a commitment to outstanding service, **Access Professional Interpreting** ensures its interpreters are nationally certified and licensed by the State of Arizona. They are also screened for skill and professionalism, reflecting a dedication to quality. Moreover, the organization aims to deliver reliable, efficient, and cost-effective interpreting services, thereby meeting the diverse communication needs of its clients. You can also request these services through the website.

**Access Professional Interpreting** offers various services, including ASL interpreters, legal ASL interpreters, Deaf Interpreters (CDIs), and interpreters for the Deaf-Blind. Furthermore, they also provide CART (Communication Access Realtime Translation) services. The team also welcomes freelance interpreters. For this purpose, the website offers a registration form for those interested in joining the team. So, whether you need an interpreter or are a qualified interpreter, the website provides helpful resources.

Learn more at https://www.apinterpreting.com/ and explore other vision-focused resources at the Eye Spy directory.

listing_title: Area Agency on Aging - Maricopa County
ai_yoast_description:
SEO-Optimized Description for Area Agency on Aging - Maricopa County

Area Agency on Aging - Maricopa County is dedicated to enhancing the quality of life for older adults, caregivers, and underserved populations within Maricopa County. Through a comprehensive range of programs and services, the organization works diligently to support the well-being of the community. The mission centers around fostering innovative initiatives, ultimately enriching the lives of those navigating the aging process.

Moreover, the vision is to create a community where adults thrive throughout their life's journey. The Area Agency on Aging, also known as Region One, functions as a 501(c)(3) non-profit. As a result, it is responsible for the planning, development, funding, and coordination of programs and services. These services cater to individuals aged 60 and over, their family caregivers, and adults aged 18-59 with disabilities.

Consequently, the Area Agency on Aging also assists special populations including elder refugees, those with behavioral health conditions, and victims of late-life domestic violence. The agency operates as a licensed behavioral health provider. Furthermore, it is certified to bill both Medicare and AHCCCS for mental health services. Besides, the 24-Hour Senior HELP LINE is available for help and support.

In conclusion, the Area Agency on Aging provides crucial resources for seniors and caregivers in Maricopa County. Also, the organization is committed to valuing and supporting all people as they age. Additionally, they offer various programs like the 24-Hour Senior HELP LINE, AmeriCorps, Benefits Assistance Program, DOVES®, ElderVention®, and Family Caregiver Support. Learn more at https://www.aaaphx.org/ and explore other vision-focused resources at the Eye Spy directory.

AZFLIS's mission is to ensure seamless communication for those with hearing impairments. Their goal is to maintain 100% quality service and to maximize customer satisfaction. Subsequently, AZFLIS strives to offer professional, timely service.

The website showcases the dedication and experience of AZFLIS's leadership. Joni M. Horn, the Owner and President, brings over 30 years of interpreting experience, with a deep understanding of the Deaf community. Furthermore, Cassandra Hoots, the Chief Operations Officer, and Amy Troyer, the Senior Scheduling Coordinator and Office Manager, contribute to the smooth and efficient operations of the company. Therefore, their collective experience ensures AZFLIS provides high-quality interpreting solutions.

The services of AZFLIS extend beyond standard ASL interpreting. They also offer ASL video production and video remote interpreting (VRI). As a result, these services guarantee accessibility in various settings, be it legal proceedings or virtual meetings. In addition to the core services, the website also serves as a resource for the community, therefore, featuring information on how to become an ASL interpreter.

In conclusion, AZFLIS is dedicated to improving access to communication for the Deaf and Hard of Hearing community. The Phoenix Public Library aims to ensure that everyone can access and use all offered resources.

Specifically, if individuals feel they have been denied service or faced any form of discrimination, they are provided with clear avenues for filing ADA complaints. For instance, for Phoenix-operated services, individuals can contact 602-262-7242, or for Valley Metro-operated services, they can call 602-253-5000. In summary, the City of Phoenix’s public transit system embodies a strong commitment to accessibility and inclusion. listing_title: Department of Veterans Affairs: Blind Rehabilitation Services
ai_yoast_description:
Department of Veterans Affairs: Blind Rehabilitation Services - Overview

The Department of Veterans Affairs' (Department of Veterans Affairs) Blind Rehabilitation Services (BRS) is dedicated to assisting eligible Veterans and active-duty service members experiencing vision loss. Accordingly, the BRS ensures comprehensive support, integrating vision rehabilitation seamlessly into VA healthcare benefits. This integrated approach guarantees access to premier medical and rehabilitative care. Moreover, it provides state-of-the-art assistive technology designed to promote independence.

The mission of the BRS, therefore, centers on empowering visually impaired Veterans and service members. The mission is achieved through the development of essential skills. These skills are critical for personal independence and successful reintegration into both the community and family environments. The organization's vision is to enable Veterans and service members to lead fulfilling lives. They reclaim the confidence and necessary skills to thrive after vision loss.

Furthermore, the core offerings encompass comprehensive care coordination, assessments, and therapeutic instruction. Eligible individuals receive support from specialized Blind Rehabilitation Centers, outpatient clinics, and dedicated VIST Coordinators. Resources are also readily available for those seeking to improve their quality of life. Through these services, BRS offers extensive support for veterans, helping them with challenges related to vision loss. In conclusion, the organization’s aim is to facilitate a return to community and family life.

The services provided include assistance with daily living skills, orientation and mobility training, and access to low vision devices. BRS serves Veterans and active-duty Service members with vision loss that cannot be corrected with regular eyeglasses, and who have difficulties with at least one task. BRS facilitates a return to independence for those who have served. Consequently, services provided empower veterans to continue living independent and fulfilling lives.

Learn more at https://www.rehab.va.gov/prosthetics/blindrehab/index.asp and explore other vision-focused resources at the Eye Spy directory.

Hopi Tribe Vocational Rehabilitation Program: Empowering the Visually Impaired

The official website for the Hopi Tribe Vocational Rehabilitation Program provides information and services to assist the visually impaired community. Indeed, its mission is to foster growth and independence for individuals, their families, and communities facing disabilities. Moreover, the website serves as a crucial resource for those seeking to improve their quality of life through employment opportunities. The core purpose is to guide individuals with disabilities toward securing meaningful employment, catering to their unique job history, existing disabilities, and future aspirations. This program is designed to create a pathway to self-sufficiency and empower individuals.

The program collaborates with various entities, including employers, vocational schools, and colleges. Similarly, it facilitates on-the-job training and job placement services. Further, it offers comprehensive support through job preparation assistance, application guidance, resume writing services, vocational counseling, and job coaching. Therefore, this provides opportunities for career planning, skill development, self-employment initiatives, and transportation support. Furthermore, the website outlines the eligibility criteria for the program, which includes enrollment in a federally recognized tribe, residing on the Hopi Indian Reservation, and having a disability that presents a barrier to employment. However, individuals must be able to gain successful employment with the help of the program.

Consequently, the Hopi Tribe Vocational Rehabilitation Program plays a crucial role in the community. The website lists contact information for program staff and therefore promotes accessibility for those seeking assistance. Furthermore, the website promotes the program and provides an overview of the services offered. Also, the Hopi Tribe is dedicated to creating a supportive environment where individuals can thrive. ai_yoast_description:
Little Eyes International: Restoring Vision, Inspiring Futures

Little Eyes International, a dedicated 501(c)(3) nonprofit based in Arizona, strives to offer critical eye care services to children. The mission focuses on preventing and curing childhood blindness, especially within underserved communities in Arizona and Mexico. Recognizing the global shortage of pediatric ophthalmologists, the organization addresses the crucial need for accessible eye care.

The focus of Little Eyes International is broad, addressing the lack of vision care by providing a range of services. These include comprehensive eye exams, diagnoses, and treatments for conditions such as Amblyopia and Strabismus. In addition, the organization offers access to eyeglasses, eye care education, and surgical interventions when necessary. Because many causes of childhood blindness are preventable, early intervention is of the utmost importance, especially for children in developing countries and even within the United States.

Founded by Dr. Laura Kueny and Dr. Patrick Burke in July 2021, the organization quickly established partnerships to increase its impact. For example, Little Eyes International has partnered with the Rocky Point Medical Center in Puerto Peñasco, Sonora, Mexico. Through these collaborative efforts, they provide monthly pediatric eye clinics and vision screenings and offer free prescription eyeglasses to children in need. Furthermore, Little Eyes International continues to expand its reach and impact.

Furthermore, to advance their mission, Little Eyes International has established ambitious fundraising goals. First, they seek funds to obtain essential equipment, which will then allow for the local production of eyeglasses in Puerto Peñasco. Also, they are raising funds to set up operating rooms, allowing them to provide sight-saving procedures for children. By working to improve the vision of children, the organization seeks to create a lasting impact on their lives and futures.

Therefore, the dedication to accessible eye care demonstrates its commitment to creating a brighter future for children. The organization currently focuses on offering high-quality eye care services to children who need them. Additionally, the work aligns with the global need to address the issue of vision loss.

Learn more at https://www.littleeyesinternational.com/ and explore other vision-focused resources at the Eye Spy directory.
ai_wp_excerpt: Little Eyes International is a non-profit dedicated to preventing and curing childhood blindness. Based in Arizona, the organization provides optical, clinical, and surgical eye care to underserved children in Arizona and Mexico. Learn more about their mission and how you can support their work to improve the vision of children.
listing_tags: Little Eyes International,Arizona,AZ

Ultimately, the National Federation of the Blind of Arizona empowers blind individuals by fostering a supportive community, advocating for their rights, and educating the public about blindness. ai_yoast_description:
Empowering Northern Arizona Communities: An Overview of Services

Northern Arizona Council of Governments (NACOG) is a non-profit organization representing local governments. Primarily, the focus lies in delivering a diverse range of services across Apache, Coconino, Navajo, and Yavapai Counties. Moreover, it strives to address common issues with uncommon solutions, transcending geographical boundaries to enhance local communities. Therefore, NACOG's commitment reflects its mission to improve the lives of citizens in the region through regional collaboration.

Furthermore, NACOG actively works with local governments. Thus, it enables them to confront similar challenges faced within the region's communities. Consequently, NACOG is dedicated to fostering economic success. It accomplishes this through workforce development partnerships and comprehensive economic development planning. In addition, it concentrates on workforce, business services, tourism development, public works, and infrastructure development. Ultimately, these efforts are dedicated to sustainable economic growth.

In addition, the organization's mission extends to supporting human and community services. For example, this involves advocating for equal opportunities for people with disabilities, delivering services to seniors, and combating poverty. Therefore, the Community Services division facilitates programs like utility and energy assistance, housing support, and transportation services. Consequently, the strategic focus on comprehensive child development and family support services for those economically disadvantaged is vital. Thus, NACOG’s work helps children and their families.

Besides, NACOG’s planning division provides local governments with essential services such as population studies and demographic analysis. Similarly, NACOG offers estimates and projections for population growth. Also, it actively participates in regional transit planning. Thus, it coordinates with the Arizona Department of Transportation and local governments to secure transportation-related funding. Subsequently, it develops and maintains area-wide water quality management plans.

Therefore, it’s clear that the Northern Arizona Council of Governments is committed to serving its community. The organization strives to provide a valuable service to northern Arizona communities. As a result, this commitment results in a positive impact.

Learn more at https://www.nacog.org/ and explore other vision-focused resources at the Eye Spy directory.

ai_yoast_description:
Disability Resources at Northern Arizona University: Promoting Accessibility and Inclusion

Disability Resources (DR) at Northern Arizona University plays a vital role in fostering an inclusive and accessible environment for all students and employees. Therefore, DR proactively collaborates with the campus community to eliminate barriers and promote full participation for individuals with disabilities. Consequently, DR is dedicated to ensuring that all programs, services, and activities at NAU are accessible, and accessible at no cost to the NAU community.

Importantly, the mission of DR is centered on the core values of equal opportunity and inclusion. In addition to providing accommodations, DR also works towards building a universally designed environment. Thus, DR offers a wide range of services to support individuals with various disabilities, including those with visual impairments. For example, DR ensures the provision of alternative formats for print materials. Additionally, DR facilitates access to assistive technologies.

Furthermore, the team at Disability Resources is committed to providing comprehensive support. Moreover, the team provides resources and guidance on accessibility, including specialized software and equipment. In addition to providing services, DR also works to educate the campus community about disability awareness. Therefore, DR strives to create a campus culture where all students and employees feel welcome and supported.

Disability Resources facilitates a variety of accommodations tailored to support students and employees. So, they provide access to assistive technology, academic adjustments like extended time on exams, and accessible testing environments. Also, DR coordinates with other university departments, like Housing and Residence Life, to provide housing accommodations. Therefore, the ultimate aim of DR is to empower individuals and remove obstacles to their success.

Therefore, DR ensures equal access to education and employment opportunities at Northern Arizona University. Because of this commitment to inclusion, the entire university community benefits.

Learn more at https://in.nau.edu/disability-resources/ and explore other vision-focused resources at the Eye Spy directory.

listing_title: Northland Pioneer College - Office of Accessibility & Inclusion - Support Services For Students With Disabilities
ai_yoast_description:
Northland Pioneer College - Your Pathway to Accessible Education

Northland Pioneer College (NPC) is dedicated to providing accessible and affordable educational opportunities for all students. The mission of NPC is to deliver educational excellence that enriches communities across northeastern Arizona. While the primary focus of this description will be on resources toward the visually impaired community, you should also know that NPC offers a wide array of degrees, certificates, and support services to ensure that every student can achieve their academic goals.

The Office of Accessibility & Inclusion is dedicated to supporting students with disabilities. Therefore, NPC's vision is to be a leader in accessible education, ensuring that all students have equal access to learning and campus life. Support services at NPC are designed to facilitate access to classes and activities. For instance, support services available through the Student Accommodation Services office are available to all students.

Subsequently, NPC provides resources such as Student Accommodation Services (SAS). The SAS is responsible for coordinating support services for students with disabilities, adhering to the Americans with Disabilities Act (ADA) and Section 504. These services are determined on an individual basis and provided at no charge. The commitment of NPC is reflected in its inclusive practices, ensuring that students with disabilities can thrive academically and socially.

Moreover, the college offers several degree options, including University Transfer Degrees and Direct to Work Degrees/Certificates, and offers online classes, among others. NPC promotes a supportive environment for all students. NPC is committed to offering assistance and resources to all, which includes the visually impaired.

In conclusion, Northland Pioneer College strives to break down barriers and foster an inclusive environment where students with disabilities can thrive. Therefore, the services offered by NPC are a testament to its commitment to creating accessible education.

Learn more at https://www.npc.edu/oai and explore other vision-focused resources at the Eye Spy directory.

ai_yoast_description:
Professional Court Interpreting and Translation Services: Your Global Language Solution

PCI PROFESSIONAL COURT INTERPRETING & TRANSLATION SERVICES is a premier provider of professional interpreting and translation services, dedicated to bridging language gaps across the globe. Established in 1991, the organization has built a strong reputation for accuracy, reliability, and commitment to excellence. The services are comprehensive, catering to diverse legal and medical needs. Furthermore, the team at PCI PROFESSIONAL COURT INTERPRETING & TRANSLATION SERVICES understands the critical nature of these services, providing clear and precise interpretations and translations. Therefore, clients can depend on the experience and expertise of a dedicated team.

Moreover, the organization offers interpreting services for legal proceedings. The coverage includes arbitrations, depositions, trials, arraignments, sentencing, hearings, administrative law hearings, civil traffic hearings, child support hearings, labor law disputes, and workers' compensation hearings. In addition to legal interpretation, PCI PROFESSIONAL COURT INTERPRETING & TRANSLATION SERVICES provides translation services for essential documents. Consequently, the ability to understand and navigate complex legal and medical situations is enhanced.

Consequently, beyond legal settings, the team offers comprehensive medical interpretation. This includes psychiatric and neurological evaluations, independent medical evaluations, and disability determination exams. In addition, the scope of services also extends to formal and informal settings. These are child protective service meetings, recorded statements for insurance companies, polygraph exams, investigations, and various document translations. The team is also able to provide support for over 150 languages and 83 dialects.

The dedication to quality and detail ensures accurate communication. Consequently, PCI PROFESSIONAL COURT INTERPRETING & TRANSLATION SERVICES is more than just a service; it is a partner. The firm helps clients navigate complex situations. It is committed to facilitating clear and effective communication. Finally, with a wide range of language capabilities and experienced professionals, PCI PROFESSIONAL COURT INTERPRETING & TRANSLATION SERVICES remains a trusted choice.

ai_wp_excerpt: Saavi Services for the Blind empowers individuals with low vision through non-visual training and resources. We offer programs for adults, seniors, children, and youth in Arizona, focusing on independence, education, and employment. Join us in achieving more!
short_description: SAAVI Services for the Blind empowers individuals with blindness and low vision in Arizona through training, education, and employment programs that promote independence and confidence.
description: Saavi Services for the Blind is a nonprofit organization serving individuals with blindness and low vision throughout Arizona. With locations in Tucson and Phoenix, SAAVI offers accessible, life-changing programs that empower people to live independently and confidently, no matter their stage in life. While they no longer have a physical location in Yuma, adults from anywhere in the nation can participate in their comprehensive training programs based in Phoenix and Tucson. SAAVI’s programs range from mobility and independent living skills to technology training, education, and job readiness. Their philosophy—“It’s not blindness that holds you back, but low expectations”—drives their belief in the abilities of each individual. SAAVI’s services are built around the Structured Discovery model, a hands-on approach that promotes real-world learning and self-confidence. From youth transition programs to senior services and remote training options, SAAVI helps people navigate vision loss with independence and resilience. The organization also collaborates with employers and community partners to create meaningful opportunities for education, work, and social connection. Youth from all over the country can also participate in the Ready Set Go Summer Camp (RSG 2025), which may currently be full. SAAVI’s staff includes many individuals who are blind or low vision themselves, bringing personal experience and deep understanding into every service offered. Through its inclusive and empowering approach, SAAVI changes lives every day. To learn more about their programs and get involved, visit saavi.us. For more inclusive resources, visit the EyeSpy.org directory.
listing_tags: Saavi Services for the Blind - Phoenix,Phoenix,Arizona,AZ

listing_title: The White Mountain Apache Tribe Vocational Rehabilitation
ai_yoast_description:
Empowering the Visually Impaired: Vocational Rehabilitation Services by The White Mountain Apache Tribe

The mission of The White Mountain Apache Tribe Vocational Rehabilitation is to assist visually impaired individuals to achieve their employment goals. This program, managed within the WMAT Education Department, provides comprehensive vocational rehabilitation services. Furthermore, these services are designed to align with the individual's unique strengths, priorities, and capabilities. Consequently, the goal is to help individuals find and maintain meaningful employment.

The program is funded by a grant from the U.S. Department of Education. It offers a range of services for eligible members of the White Mountain Apache Tribe. Therefore, to qualify, one must be an enrolled tribal member residing on or near the Fort Apache Indian Reservation. Additionally, the individual's disability must significantly impact their ability to secure or retain employment, and furthermore, the available services must be able to help in obtaining or maintaining employment.

The scope of services includes assessments to determine eligibility and vocational needs. Also, it covers counseling, guidance, and job placement assistance. Moreover, vocational and other training services are available. Similarly, services can cover mental and physical restoration. Also, it addresses additional costs incurred during rehabilitation. Moreover, interpreter services for the deaf and services for those who are blind or visually impaired are available. Finally, the program may provide support for occupational licenses, tools, and supplies. Also, it offers Native healing services and information and referrals.

To apply for these valuable services, individuals are encouraged to visit or call the office to schedule an appointment. Upon receiving an application, the WMATVR staff will conduct an initial intake interview. The purpose is to assess eligibility and determine the most appropriate services. Crucially, the applicant's full participation is vital to a successful outcome. Consequently, applicants will be assigned a vocational rehabilitation counselor. The counselor will provide the necessary support and guidance. In conclusion, the support is aimed at achieving the individual's employment goals.

Learn more at http://www.wmat.us/vocational_rehab.html and explore other vision-focused resources at the Eye Spy directory.
ai_wp_excerpt: The White Mountain Apache Tribe Vocational Rehabilitation provides services to assist people with low vision and other disabilities in obtaining and retaining employment. They offer assessments, counseling, training, and other support services to promote independence and achieve employment goals. Contact the Education Department for more information.

description: The Vision Rehabilitation and Technology Expo Association (VRATE) is a 501(c)(3) nonprofit dedicated to increasing educational and employment outcomes and improving quality of life for Arizonans who are blind, low vision, or DeafBlind. VRATE’s annual expo, held at the Ability360 Sports & Fitness Center in Phoenix, features hands-on demonstrations, workshops, and presentations on the latest assistive technologies and resources. The event fosters self-determination, full inclusion, and community connection, offering accessible information, networking, and opportunities for all ages. ASL interpreting and CART services are provided for full participation. For more information, contact info@vrate.org or call 1-877-298-7283.
